Server module¶

Messenger’s server module. Processes message dictionaries, stores RSA public keys of clients.

Usage:

The module supports the following command line arguments:

-a, --addr

Address from which the connection is accepted. If blank, then connection is accepted from all addresses.

-p, --port

Listening port that accepts the connections

-n, --no_gui

The ‘no gui’ flag. If present the server module will run in console window with limited functionality. Note, that in this mode only one command is supported: exit - stops the server.

Examples:

  • python server.py -p 8080

Starts the server at port 8080

  • python server.py -a localhost

Starts the server that accepts connections from localhost only

  • python server.py -n

Starts the server with no GUI

server.py¶

The main module of the server application, includes parsers for command line arguments, configuration file and the main loop. The main server loop works the following way: first it acquires the launch and configuration parameters, then launches the server thread and initializes the GUI.

server_core.py¶

class serverapp.server_core.MessagingServer(listening_address: str, listening_port: int, db: serverapp.server_db.ServerDatabase)¶

The main class of the server.

__init__(listening_address: str, listening_port: int, db: serverapp.server_db.ServerDatabase)¶

Server initialization. Creates the attributes needed for the server to work, sets the working flag as True.

Parameters

  • listening_address – server’s IP address

  • listening_port – server’s port

  • db – server’s database

authorize_client(message: dict, client: socket.socket)¶

Handles the client’s authorization. Checks if the username isn’t already taken, then checks if the user is registered on the server. If those two checks pass, the method then initiates the exchange of encrypted passwords with the client. If the password is correct, the client is logged onto the server, otherwise the client is removed from the server and his socket gets closed.

Parameters

  • message – presence message

  • client – client’s socket

delete_client(client: socket.socket)¶

Closes the connection with the client who decided to leave the server. Logs him out in the DB, deletes from the list of active users and closes the socket.

Parameters

client – client’s socket

process_client_message(message: dict, client: socket.socket)¶

Handles the messages from clients according to their service codes. This method handles authorization, client’s exit, contact list, existing users’ and public key requests, requests to add or delete a contact and messages from client to client (this method also records these messages to server DB). This method triggers a relevant handler if needed, or tries to send a response with a relevant service code (200, 202, 511 or 400 in case of bad request). If sending a message was not possible, this method deletes the user from the list of active users.

Parameters

  • message – dictionary with a message

  • client – client’s socket

run()¶

The main loop of the server. Creates a listening socket, and then accepts connections while the working flag is True. If there are clients with messages, sends them.

send_client_message(message: dict)¶

Handles the exchange of messages between clients. Validates the message and sends it if correct

Parameters

message – dictionary with the message

update_list()¶

Generates the message with 205 code that triggers the update of contact and active users’ lists for all active clients.

Representation of the server’s database.

Parameters

  • address – client’s IP address

  • port – client’s port

  • date – date and time of activity

Parameters

  • password_hash – hashed password

  • contact – contact itself

class UserLoginHistory(login: str, address: str, port: int, date: datetime.datetime)¶

Representation class for table with users’ login history.

__init__(login: str, address: str, port: int, date: datetime.datetime)¶

Initialization of the table.

Parameters

  • login – client’s nickname

  • address – client’s IP address

  • port – client’s port

  • date – date and time of activity

__init__(filepath: str)¶

Initialization and creation of tables. Creates all the tables, mappers and a session. Deletes all previous entries from the table of active users.

Parameters

filepath – path to DB

add_contact_to_list(owner: str, contact: str)¶

Handles adding one user to the contacts of another. Checks if the user is already in the contact list and finishes working if they do, otherwise adds new entry to the Contacts table.

Parameters

  • owner – the owner of the contact

  • contact – user to be added to contact list

all_active_users_list() → list¶

Returns the list of tuples with entries of all currently active users.

all_users_list() → list¶

Returns the list of tuples with entries of all existing users.

check_existing_user(login: str) → bool¶

Checks if such user already exists on the server. Returns True if they do, False otherwise.

Parameters

login – client’s nickname

get_message_history() → list¶

Returns the list of tuples with entries of users’ message history.

get_user_contact_list(user: str) → list¶

Returns the list of strings with nicknames of all the contacts of a specific user.

Parameters

user – client’s nickname

get_user_public_key(login: str) → Crypto.PublicKey.RSA.RsaKey¶

Returns the public RSA key of the user.

Parameters

login – client’s nickname

get_user_pwd_hash(login: str) → bytes¶

Returns the hashed password of the user.

Parameters

login – client’s nickname

login_user(login: str, ip: str, port: int, key: Crypto.PublicKey.RSA.RsaKey)¶

Handles the login process for clients. Checks if user is already registered on the server, and if he is logs him in, adds him to the table of active users and makes a new entry to the login history table.

Parameters

  • login – client’s nickname

  • ip – client’s IP address

  • port – client’s port

  • key – client’s public RSA key

logout_user(login: str)¶

Handles the logout process on the server. Deletes the user from the table of active users.

Parameters

login – client’s nickname

record_message_to_history(sender: str, recipient: str)¶

Records message to message history.

Parameters

  • sender – self-explanatory

  • recipient – self-explanatory as well

register_user(login: str, pwd_hash: bytes)¶

Handles the registration of a new user on the server. Creates a new entry to the All Users table and User Action History table.

Parameters

  • login – client’s nickname

  • pwd_hash – hashed password

remove_contact_from_list(owner: str, contact: str)¶

Handles the removal of one user from the contacts of another. Checks if the user is actually in the contact list and finishes working if they aren’t, otherwise deletes the entry from the Contacts table.

Parameters

  • owner – the owner of the contact

  • contact – user to be removed from the contact list

remove_user_from_db(login: str)¶

Removes the user and entries related to him from all the tables! ALL OF THEM!

Parameters

login – client’s nickname

show_user_login_history(user: Optional[str] = None) → list¶

Returns the list of tuples with login history of either all users or one specific user.

Parameters

user – client’s nickname

server_gui.py¶

class serverapp.server_gui.MainWindow(server: serverapp.server_core.MessagingServer, db: serverapp.server_db.ServerDatabase, config: configparser.ConfigParser)¶

Main class of GUI.

__init__(server: serverapp.server_core.MessagingServer, db: serverapp.server_db.ServerDatabase, config: configparser.ConfigParser)¶

GUI initialization. Creates all the elements, creates the status bar and connects all the buttons to their respective handlers.

Parameters

  • server – server thread

  • db – server database

  • config – server configuration file

configure_server()¶

Modal window with server configuration.

create_active_users_model()¶

Creates the model of all currently active users to show in the main window of the app. Queries the DB and adds entries to the model.

delete_user()¶

Modal window with client deletion.

register_user()¶

Modal window with client registration. That is the only way someone can be registered in the chat.

show_users_stats()¶

Modal window with users’ action history.

server_config_window.py¶

class serverapp.server_config_window.ConfigWindow(config: configparser.ConfigParser)¶

Main GUI class

__init__(config: configparser.ConfigParser)¶

Initialization of the GUI. Sets up all the elements and connects all the buttons to their respective handlers.

Parameters

config – configuration file

file_dialog_handler()¶

Handles a modal window to choose the directory with the server DB.

save_config_data()¶

Handles the modal window with server configuration data, checks the validity of the entered values and if they aren’t valid triggers a relevant message. On success triggers a message as well.

server_reg_user.py¶

class serverapp.server_reg_user.RegisterUser(db: serverapp.server_db.ServerDatabase, server_thread: serverapp.server_core.MessagingServer)¶

Main class of GUI.

__init__(db: serverapp.server_db.ServerDatabase, server_thread: serverapp.server_core.MessagingServer)¶

Initialization of GUI. Sets up al the necessary elements, connects the “save” button to its handler.

Parameters

  • db – server database

  • server_thread – server thread

save_user()¶

Validates the entered values and triggers relevant messages if the data is not correct. Otherwise, generates the hashed password, registers the user in the DB and prompts the server to update the active users’ list.

server_rem_user.py¶

class serverapp.server_rem_user.RemoveUser(db: serverapp.server_db.ServerDatabase, server_thread: serverapp.server_core.MessagingServer)¶

Main class of GUI.

__init__(db: serverapp.server_db.ServerDatabase, server_thread: serverapp.server_core.MessagingServer)¶

Initialization of GUI. Sets up all the necessary elements, connects the button to their handlers and triggers the update of the list of existing users.

Parameters

  • db – server database

  • server_thread – server thread

remove_user()¶

Handles the deletion of the user. Checks if the user is registered on the server, deletes him and prompts the server to update the list of active users.

update_selector()¶

Updates the list of active users in the selector.
